contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox model | name = Jakki Degg | image = JakkiDeggJuly06.jpg | imagesize = 200px | caption = Degg in July 2006 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|02|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Stone, Staffordshire]], [[England]] <!-- birthplace --> | death_date = | death_place = | height = {{height|ft=5|in=3}} | dress size = | shoesize = | haircolour = Blonde | eyecolour = Brown | ethnicity = Caucasian | nationality = British | agency = | alias = | spouse = | website = }} '''Jakki Degg''' (born 20 February 1978) is an English glamour model and actress. While the bulk of her work has been done in [[England]], she has appeared in [[United States|American]] film and television, and has posed for posters and magazine pictorials. ==Early life== Although born in [[Stone, Staffordshire|Stone]], Degg was raised in [[Hednesford]], [[Staffordshire]], [[England]]. Degg studied dance as a child, particularly ballet, and won several competitions. She went on to hairdressing school and managed a salon of her own by age 20.<ref name="askmen.com">[http://www.askmen.com/celebs/women/models_300/339_jakki_degg.html Jakki Degg] at [[AskMen.com]]; Accessed July 28, 2010.</ref> ==Career== ===Modeling=== Jakki became famous when, at her mother's encouragement,<ref name="askmen.com"/> she entered and won the inaugural [[Max Power (magazine)|Max Power]] magazine babes competition. Following this she became a [[Page Three girl|Page 3 girl]] for ''[[The Sun (newspaper)|The Sun]]'' newspaper, and was voted "greatest ever Page 3 girl" in 2001.<ref>http://www.page3.com/girl/jakki_degg/biog.shtml</ref> She has posed topless and semi-nude for lad mags such as ''[[Front (magazine)|Front]]''. Degg took a break from topless modelling, preferring to remain more covered up. Jakki returned to page 3 of ''The Sun'' in August 2006 after a four-year absence. ===Acting=== Jakki has appeared on television several times. She had a small role in the drama ''[[Is Harry on the Boat?]]'' ([[Sky One]]) and played the lead in the short film ''Remember My Dream'', directed by [[Joao Costa Menezes]]. She was also a stand-in for the TV show ''The Games'' but was not used. She wielded a shotgun on [[Channel 4]]'s ''[[Banzai (television show)|Banzai]]'' as viewers were encouraged to wager on how many balloons she would pop with it. Degg won the Page 3 model charity special edition of [[BBC One|BBC1]]'s ''[[The Weakest Link]]'', beating [[Leilani Dowding]] in the sudden death round, with her winnings going to the [[RSPCA]].<ref>{{cite web| url =http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/features/life/185539/Jakki-has-the-most-up-top.html| title = Jakki has the most up top!| date = 2002-07-13| author = Giovanni Iozzi| publisher = The Sun| accessdate=2009-10-09}}</ref> However, her appearance on the show's 1,000th episode was short lived, as she was the first contestant eliminated on a countback. In 2004 she won the ''Celebrity [[24 Hour Quiz]]'' on [[ITV]] with her winnings also going to the [[RSPCA]].<ref>http://www.jakkidegg.net/biog.asp Quote: "Took part in 'Celebrity 24 Hour Quiz' on Channel 3, came runner up and won just under Â£5000 which she again donated to the R.S.P.C.A."</ref> She also appeared in ''The Poker Academy'', and the American film ''[[Eurotrip]]''. == References == {{reflist}} == External links == {{Commons category}} * [http://www.jakkidegg.net/ Jakki Degg's official site] * [http://www.page3.com/thegirls/jakkis-profile-18040.html Jakki's profile] at [http://www.page3.com/ Page 3.com] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Degg, Jakki | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =1978-02-20 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Stone, Staffordshire]], [[England]] <!-- birthplace --> | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Degg, Jakki}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Glamour models]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Page Three girls]] [[Category:People from Stone, Staffordshire]]
